lexUnit.name: discard.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: get rid of as no longer useful or desirable

sentence.text: Step-by-step writing allows you to do this , and commits you to making progress , even if later you discard what you have done .
Smith lit a cigarette and discarded the match amongst the debris .
Grant hesitated momentarily , reluctant to discard the main weapon in his arsenal .
Jenkins said , deftly taking the coaster from Laidlaw 's hand and discarding it unobtrusively in the bin under the counter .
When Peter the Great took the final step of proclaiming himself Emperor in 1721 he discarded the jewelled cap in which he and his brother Ivan had originally been crowned in 1682 .
They discarded the broken spar over the side where it was picked up by the Nippon tender .
At least that meant she would n't have to discard her towel under Luke 's assessing gaze , Folly thought .
Discard the bad peel after it has dried , then repolish and etch the face .
Samsung has been trying to discard its somewhat downmarket image for some time .
Alexei constructed a suitable reply , then discarded it in favour of plain truth .
The explorer was obliged gradually to discard all his unnecessary belongings .
Although he did not completely discard the astrological concept of destiny , Plutarch argued that there was a place in it for contingency .
She discards her admirers as often as she discards gloves , and poor Mama spends most of her time comforting the latest reject .

A Berlin research institute is developing a scheme by which micro-organisms will feed on abandoned Trabant cars , large numbers of which have been discarded by their former East German owners in favour of more modern Western models .
Those which are being discarded , usually after 30 years and around 750,000 miles ( 1,200,000 km ) of service , are sold at 8,000 each and go on to another life overseas .
If the potato is green throughout it should be discarded .
Samples collected during the first 10 minutes after the acid pulse were discarded .
He discarded the bag and its contents .
LEFT Do not discard food or food wrappings in waste bins , because your dog is unlikely to be able to resist the temptation of scavenging , tipping the bin out in the process .
Each day the world 's merchant shipping fleet , by one reliable estimate made in 1982 , discards 639,000 plastic containers into the sea .
Next , the biologists discarded the sunglasses and standard laboratory coats , and each wore a t-shirt of a different colour .
He would pick you up and squeeze you dry and discard you when you began to bore him .
British troops in the Falklands found much hardware discarded by Argentinian troops .
Hordes of children scramble every day in the gutters for food discarded from the street stalls " .

The recent rapid expansion of Asian drift-net fleets into the South Pacific and Tasman Sea has raised fears of similar problems of entanglement of marine mammals in plastic netting lost or discarded in these areas .
He recovered but at the age of 22 was left almost completely bald and had to wear a wig , a fashion he discarded in the heat of India .
The thin pad can be rolled up and discarded with its coat of mulm , saving you a great deal of maintenance in the main filter .
Several thousand kilometres of fish netting is lost or discarded at sea annually .
Stockings and petticoats , discarded for the wash , lounged about in here , flung over the back of a carved armchair .
And then there are all those empty packets discarded out of the window onto Britain 's already polluted streets .
It lay asleep on a piece of sacking the gardener had discarded from around the rose-bush he was planting .
Having gingerly discarded over a hedge bits of rotted fruit and suspect cheese , I lunched on olives and mineral water in the shade of a great oak wood .
Albert Purcell ( above ) at the drop hammer , is producing a range of hand forged and finished turning and carving tools , using methods most of the industry has discarded .
Some she discarded and threw into the fire , others she kept .
He summoned up from the past the accent he had spent years discarding and bowed to the two men .
